strings.Value: "What is it, Tristian?"
"Not now."
"I like you, Tristian. I want us to get to know each other better."
"Don't worry about it. We're partners. That's enough."
"I see you're a little dumb."
[Kiss Tristian] "I will show you everything you need to know!"
"How would you know? Maybe it's your 'ignorance' that attracts me, hm?"
"You're right. Let's keep everything as it is."
"I like you just the way you are. I hope you feel the same about me."
"Sorry."
"What's wrong with you?!"
"You don't like me that much?"
{n}Tristian looks at you hesitantly, even tensely.{/n} "{name}, could you spare me a few minutes?"
{n}The priest nods silently and looks away.{/n}

"Forgive me if I ramble, I'm not used to such conversations. I can't get your words about... Us... out of my head. It's like you want something more of me, and I can't understand what it is." {n}Tristian looks at you attentively.{/n}
{n}Tristian raises an eyebrow.{/n} "I see you're not in the mood. I think I'll spare you this conversation."

{n}Tristian processes your words for a few moments, then coughs awkwardly.{/n} "I'm afraid of disappointing you, {name}. I know little about the feelings of mortals — all my life has been devoted to serving {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g}. I wouldn't want my... ignorance to push you away."
{n}Tristian nods hesitantly.{/n} "All right. I just wouldn't want anything left unsaid between us."

{n}Tristian looks you in the eye and leans forward slightly, as if he's about to confess something. A moment later, he sighs and pulls away.{/n} "I care about you, {name}. It hurts me to think that we might have a fight."
{n}You lean forward, but Tristian pulls away. A gloomy shadow seems to cross his face.{/n} "Please don't do that again."

{n}Tristian arches his eyebrow, puzzled.{/n} "This sounds... strange." {n}The priest tilts his head and smiles.{/n} "I'm used to being appreciated for my knowledge, not for my inexperience." {n}Tristian lingers.{/n} "You surprise me. Again and again."
{n}Tristian smiles at you encouragingly.{/n} "Oh, don't apologize, please! It's just..." {n}The priest sighs.{/n} "I told you — I'm afraid I might disappoint you. And I think I already have."
{n}Tristian shakes his head.{/n} "It's not about that! It's... just... let's just forget about it, all right? You have enough trouble without me." {n}The priest turns away quickly.{/n}
{n}Tristian looks at you gloomily.{/n} "I could ask you the same question. Let's just forget it."
"I've wasted enough of your time. Let's talk later."
